messages.content: man is spelt M A N. nan is spelt N A N. what is the common suffix between these two words?
The common suffix between "man" and "nan" is "an."

"An" is a common suffix in English words that denotes a small amount or a unit of measure. It can be used to form words such as "nan" (a unit of measurement for mass), "man" (a unit of measurement for length), "woman" (a unit of measurement for weight), and so on. The word "an" itself has no meaning, but it is often used to create new words in English.
No, I mean as a standalone word, what does it mean?

As a standalone word, "an" is a word that is used as a prefix or suffix in English words. It is often used to form words that indicate a small amount or a unit of measure. For example, "nan" means a unit of measurement for mass, "man" means a unit of measurement for length, "woman" means a unit of measurement for weight, and so on. The word "an" itself has no meaning as a standalone word, but it plays a role in creating new words in English.
